title.rendered: TOP NBA/FOOTBALL PLAYERS WITH NIGERIAN DESCENT 2021.

content.rendered:
Top 5 NBA Players of Nigerian Descent in 2020 NBA players of Nigerian descent 2021

It’s hard to go to any country in the world and not find Nigerians there so it makes sense there will be NBA players of Nigerian descent. Being the most populous black nation in the world, Nigerians are well known and some have migrated to many countries of the world in search of greener pastures. Some go to these countries, marry a native and start procreating, the chain continues, the bloodline.

The NBA is the biggest basketball league in the world and you would be foolish to bet against not having a Nigerian in this American league; certainly. In this post, we will list for you the 5 biggest NBA players of Nigerian descent currently.

NBA Players of Nigerian Descent in 2021
Giannis Antetokounmpo
Victor Oladipo
Andre Iguodala
Josh Okogie
Deandre Ayton
NBA Players of Nigerian Descent in 2020
Giannis Antetokounmpo
Who else than the current NBA MVP? Gannis needs to introduction. Born in the small Greek town of Sepolia to Nigerian immigrant parents, the 6ft11 Milwaukee Bucks forward is the first player in NBA history to finish a regular season in the top 20 in total points.

NBA players of Nigerian descent 2019
Giannis Antetokounmpo

With the Bucks Giannis had a defining moment in his career last season and holds the NBA’s MVP title, he was also the star cover for NBA2K18. From rags to riches, Giannis went from sharing a pair of shoes with his brothers to having his own Nike line signature sneakers. Giannis represents Greece naturally and proudly identifies with Nigeria. The Greek Freak, they call him.

Victor Oladipo
Vic is an NBA player with the Indiana Pacers. Oladipo is a Nigerian Yoruba name but according to his Wikipedia page, his father is Sierra Leone, the mum is a Nigerian immigrant, albeit.

In his first season with the Indiana Pacers, Oladipo won the NBS Most Improved Player Award. Oladipo had an injury-ravaged season in the just-concluded NBA season but he still made it to the Eastern Conference All-Star reserve squad.

Andre Iguodala
Iguodala has an African-American mother and a Nigerian father. He currently plays for the Memphis Grizzles and identifies as an American. From 2013-2019, Iguodala played for the Golden State Warriors alongside. Steph Curry where he enjoyed a successful career.

Amongst many of his accolades includes NBA All-Star team 2012, 2x NBA All-Star Defensive Team, NBA MVP in 2015, and 3x NBA Champions with the. Golden State Warriors.

Josh Okogie
Josh Okogie was born in Lagos and Identifies as Nigerian-American. He got drafted into the NBA last year and plays for the Minnesota Wolves.

Okogie is still very young and had an impressive rookie season with the. Wolves, bigger things are expected of him in the new season.

Deandre Ayton
Just like Okogie, Ayton made it to the NBA draft 2018 with the Phoenix Suns. He represents the Bahamas though born to a Nigerian Father and Bahamian mother of Jamaica descent.

Ayton made it to the NBA All-Rookie First Team for the 2018-2019 season and bigger things are expected of him in the new season.
There you have it; these are the biggest NBA players of Nigerian descent. Currently. Bar Andre Iguodala, the other players are still young and will make waves for years in the Northern American basketball league.

Top 10 Footballers of Nigerian Descent Playing for Other Countries in 2021

Forget about the corruption and the bad things happening in the country, Nigeria is one country that is blessed. Blessed with top football talents, blessed with natural resources, and all kinds of people, you will never find a boring day.

No matter where you go in the world Nigerians or people connected with Nigeria one way or the other are everywhere, example of these are footballers of Nigerian descent playing for other countries. These guys either have Nigerian parents, a Nigerian father or mother, grew up abroad, or have ties with the country one way or the other.

Footballers of Nigerian Descent Playing for Other Countries.
Footballers of Nigerian Descent Playing for Other Countries
These are the best footballers of Nigerian descent playing for other countries at the moment.

David Alaba
David Olatokunbo Alaba needs no introduction in the football world, born in Vienna to a Filipino and Yoruba-Nigerian father, the Bayern Munich left-back is one of the best in the world in his position. David identifies with his Nigerian roots but represents the Austrian National team, the country of his birth.
David mentioned one time in the news he was never approached by the Nigerian FA, one would wonder what those in that glass house do. Nigeria has not had a proper left-back since Taiye Taiwo left the National team.

Dele Alli
Bamidele Alli is one of the best young players in the world in his position. Ever since he left his hometown’s club MK Dons to join Tottenham, he’s blossomed into one of the best attacking midfielders in the world. Dele has a Nigerian father and an English mother, he lived in Nigeria for 2 years with his father and went back to England. According to the papers, Dele’s father nor his alcoholic mother were there for him growing up and he grew up with foster parents even though he was never legally adopted.

Dele used to have his father’s name Alli at the back of his shirt but later changed it to Dele because he felt no connection with the Alli surname.

Ross Barkley
Ross Barkley is a man on a mission to re-ignite his career, touted for big things in the footballing world but his career has been blighted by injuries. Grew up through the Everton Academy ranks, he joined Chelsea 2 seasons ago and was given chances to impress sparingly by Antonio Conte last season. Barkley would be hoping to finally re-ignite his career under the management of his idol, Frank Lampard.
Barkley is eligible to play for Nigeria through his grandfather but opted to play for England, the country of his birth. One of the good footballers of Nigerian descent playing for other countries at the moment.

Manuel Akanji
Akanji was born in Switzerland to a Nigerian father and Swiss mother, he chose to represent the country of his birth. He played in the 2018 FIFA World Cup in Russia and is an assured center back for Dortmund in Germany.
Akanji’s stock is on the rise and don’t be surprised to see him snapped by Barcelona, Real Madrid, Manchester City, or United soon. One of the best footballers of Nigerian descent for other countries at the moment.

Tammy Abraham
Oghenetega Tamaraebi Abraham was born in London to Nigerian parents. Still a youngster, the time feels right for Abraham to announce himself in world football as a proper striker. Loaned to Aston Villa from Chelsea last season, the lanky forward banged in 26 goals in the Championship and was the second-highest scorer. Abraham will hope to stake a claim under Frank Lampard as Chelsea’s number one striker. He has one senior cap for the England National team having represented them in all youth stages.

Ikechi Anya
Ikechi Anya Switzerland
Born in Glasgow, Scotland to a Nigerian father and a Romanian mother, Anya chose to represent the country of his birth. He played his best football with Watford from 2013 to 2016 and is currently affiliated with Derby County.

Angelo Ogbonna
Ogbonna is the first-choice center-back for West Ham in the Premier League. Born in Cassino, Italy to Nigerian immigrants. Ogbonna has one cap for the Italian Senior National Team.

Dennis Aogo
Dennis Aogo – German Nigeria
Aogo was born in Germany to a Nigerian father and a German mother. He turned down invitations from the Nigerian FA many times saying he only wanted to represent the German team. He has played for Germany on a few occasions and was named in the 2010 FIFA World Cup German squad.

He’s currently looking for a new club after being released by VfB Stuttgart.

Lookman Ademola
Ademola is an exciting young winger. Born in England to Nigerian parents, the winger has represented England National Youth Teams and is still eligible for Nigeria, according to Sky Sports News he’s open to the idea of playing for the Nigeria National team.
After spending last season on loan with RB Leipzig in the Bundesliga last season, the German club chose to make the deal permanent by splashing £22.5m on him. Watch out for Ademola.

Fikayo Tomori
Born in Canada to Nigerian parents, Tomori grew up in England and has represented both Canada and England at youth levels, he’s yet to make a senior appearance. Tomori made a big impression at Derby last season and is back to Chelsea for the new season. He was eventually called up to the England squad in 2020 and subsequently made his debut. He plies his trade onloan with AC Milan currently.
